questions.question: What is the primary function of a smart contract?

answers.a: To automatically execute agreements based on coded rules
answers.b: To store cryptocurrency in a digital wallet
answers.c: To connect devices like a Raspberry Pi to the internet
answers.d: To encrypt data for secure storage

questions.question: What is a key benefit of using smart contracts?

answers.b: They reduce the need for intermediaries like banks
answers.c: They only work with physical contracts

questions.question: Where are smart contracts typically stored and executed?
What must happen for a smart contract to perform an action?

answers.a: A user must manually approve it
answers.b: Its predefined conditions must be met
answers.c: It needs to be rewritten each time
answers.d: It must connect to a central server

questions.question: Which of these is an example of a smart contract use case?

answers.a: Sending a text message via Bluetooth
answers.b: Automatically transferring payment when a delivery is confirmed

questions.question: Who can see the code of a smart contract on a public blockchain?

answers.a: Only the person who wrote it
answers.b: Anyone with access to the blockchain
